1.title: Four Kids, One Inflatable Mattress
1.plot: With the help of a local pastor, Mary and her four children have moved out of a shelter into a safer place to live. Her family has a house filled with lots of love, but they only have one inflatable mattress to sleep on. With the help of Treger, Rob, and a team of designers, this house will become a home.

2.title: Kaitlyn's Journey Home
2.plot: Katlyn and her son Gio have been living in a shelter, but with the community's help, she finally has a house to move in to. Her best friend and mentor is helping fix it up, but can he finish construction in time for Treger, Rob, and the volunteers to furnish the house so that Katlyn can move in?

3.title: Mom Gets Much Needed Rest
3.plot: Raina was living in an unhealthy environment when she left with her five children, and they all ended up in a shelter. Raina worked tirelessly to save up for a house, and although the family is finally safe, they're living in empty rooms. They could use some help from Treger, Rob, and the volunteers to turn this house into a home.

4.title: A Veteran Finds Hope
4.plot: After serving in the Marines for five years, Sterling found himself on hard times. But when he found out he was going to be a father, he turned around his life, is now attending school, and has full custody of his three-year-old. He's sleeping on the floor so that his son has a bed. Treger, Rob and the volunteers can help this father in need.

5.title: A Medical Crisis Changes Everything
5.plot: Sonya was about to buy a house when her medical crisis struck, leaving her needing constant dialysis. She lost her job, house, and went into hiding with her kids in abandoned apartments so as not to lose them to Child Protective Services. Finally back on her feet, Treger and Rob are ready to make her new house into a custom HOME.

6.title: United We Stand
6.plot: After meeting in a shelter, two single moms--Dorothy and Amber--became quick friends, and their children got along as well. Neither family had enough for a house on their own, but TOGETHER, they were able to rent a place that both families could share. Treger and Rob celebrate these best friends and new roommates by designing a perfect house for TWO families - in one.

7.title: The Family That Sticks Together
7.plot: After facing multiple traumas, and struggling to protect and raise five children on her own, Marinna lost her job and subsequently their home. The whole family bounced between shelters and a friend's basement, and now, Marinna and her kids have a roof over their head. But it could use the Humble touch to transform it into the perfect home for six.

8.title: A Double Dose of Kindness
8.plot: After years of addiction trouble and homelessness, 29-year old Luke has finally turned his life around and is in his first apartment. But when Treger and Rob offer their help to furnish his place, he'd rather "pay it forward" and asks them to help another family he knows is in need. Now, Antoine, Arvanda and their six-year-old son Andrew are getting Humble's services with Luke pitching in - Can Treger and Rob sneak back to finish Luke's place as a surprise as well, and finish two homes in just two days?

9.title: Just the Three of Us
9.plot: Joe and Tiffany both met in a homeless shelter after battling addiction, and ended up falling in love. Once their son Joe Jr. was born, the married couple redoubled their efforts to rent their own home. With the help of the Pastor at their former shelter, Joe and Tiffany found a place, and now Treger, Rob and their band of designers and volunteers are working together to make it a perfect place for three.

10.title: A Supermom and Her Two Superheroes
10.plot: Quiana and her two young sons have lived in shelters across three different states trying to make it work. Finally in a steady situation in a townhouse with room for three, Quiana wants to be a supermom to her two superhero sons, but all they have is one twin bed to sleep on. Treger and Rob work overtime to give this single mom a safe, fun and functional home to raise her two boys in a safe, healthy environment.

11.title: It Could Happen to You
11.plot: Single-mom Shaqueena and her family of four loving kids "had it all." But after some surprise serious health issues AND multiple deaths in the extended family, Shaqueena lost her job, and moved from "homeowners" to "homeless" in a few short years. After working very hard together as a family, they are finally getting out of the shelter into a rental property they can afford. Now, Treger and Rob want to recognize their hard work with a house design that the family can truly feel is their own.

12.title: Helping Hands
12.plot: Three families' from Detroit are featured in this special look at the best helping hands Treger and Rob have given Homeless families this year: Katlyn and her son Gio get the help they need completing and furnishing their house; Sonya's medical condition wrecks her finances and she ends up homeless with her family; and a young man refuses help so that another family can receive furniture from Treger and Rob's warehouse, but as a surprise, they help the young man as well.

13.title: Family First
13.plot: Stacy is the mother to five energetic kids. Having grown up in foster care for most of her childhood, Stacy wants nothing more than to keep her family together and provide a stable home. After leaving a troubled relationship, Stacy and her kids ended up living in numerous shelters. Now she's moved into a brand new townhome, but all they have are a few blankets to sleep on. Rob and Treger are going to create a family-friendly home for this deserving mom.

imdb.plot outline: Follows hosts Treger and Rob Strasberg as they run a non-profit dedicated to helping homeless families in transition by turning their house into a home with the motto, 'design with dignity', changing lives along the way. In each episode, we meet a family emerging from difficult circumstances as they finally move into a new living space to call their own. To help the family with their fresh start, Treger, Rob, and a dedicated team of designers and volunteers will transform the family's bare house into a warm home by using their warehouse full of goods donated by people in the community.
imdb.title: Welcome Home
plot: Follows hosts Treger and Rob Strasberg as they run a non-profit dedicated to helping homeless families in transition by turning their house into a home with the motto, 'design with dignity', changing lives along the way. In each episode, we meet a family emerging from difficult circumstances as they finally move into a new living space to call their own. To help the family with their fresh start, Treger, Rob, and a dedicated team of designers and volunteers will transform the family's bare house into a warm home by using their warehouse full of goods donated by people in the community.
